Package edu.missouri.geom

Class Angle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mmkrusniak.geom.Angle
  • public class Angle
extends java.lang.Object
    A geometry component corresponding to a three-point angle. (That is, an angle between two intersecting lines.) Like all geometry components, it is immutable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Angle​(Point a, Point b, Point c)
      Initialize an angle from three points.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Point a()
      Gives the first point in the angle.
      Line ab()
      Gives the first line in the angle.

      Generates an array of angles from an array of points.
      Point b()
      Gives the second point (the vertex) in the angle.
      Line bc()
      Gives the second line in the angle.
      Point c()
      Gives the third point in the angle.
      boolean containsPoint​(Point g, double tolerance)
      Gives whether the given point lies within the angle.
      boolean isConcave()
      Gives whether the angle is concave; that is, its measure is greater than pi (in other words, its interior is the greater side).
      boolean isStraight()
      Gives whether the angle is straight; that is, its measure is exactly pi.
      boolean isStraight​(double t)
      Gives whether the angle is straight to a certain (angular) tolerance; that is, whether the angle is within that tolerance of pi.
      double measure()
      Gives the measure of the angle, in radians.
      void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Renders the angle on a Java graphics canvas.
      Angle rotate​(double theta)
      Rotates an angle about its vertex.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Angle

        public Angle​(Point a,
             Point b,
             Point c)
        Initialize an angle from three points. The second point is the vertex; the first and last define lines from the vertex.
        Parameters:
        a - One point of the angle.
        b - The vertex of the angle.
        c - Another point of the angle.

    • Method Detail

      • a

        public Point a()
        Gives the first point in the angle. @return The first point in the angle.

      • b

        public Point b()
        Gives the second point (the vertex) in the angle. @return The vertex of the angle.

      • c

        public Point c()
        Gives the third point in the angle. @return The third point in the angle.

      • ab

        public Line ab()
        Gives the first line in the angle. @return The first line in the angle.

      • bc

        public Line bc()
        Gives the second line in the angle. @return The second point in the angle.

      • containsPoint

        public boolean containsPoint​(Point g,
                             double tolerance)
        Gives whether the given point lies within the angle. (The lines are treated as rays extending out from the vertex.)
        Parameters:
        g - A point.
        tolerance - Margin of error.
        Returns:
        Whether the given point lies within the angle.

      • isConcave

        public boolean isConcave()
        Gives whether the angle is concave; that is, its measure is greater than pi (in other words, its interior is the greater side).
        Returns:
        Whether the angle is concave.

      • isStraight

        public boolean isStraight()
        Gives whether the angle is straight; that is, its measure is exactly pi.
        Returns:
        Whether the angle is a straight angle.

      • isStraight

        public boolean isStraight​(double t)
        Gives whether the angle is straight to a certain (angular) tolerance; that is, whether the angle is within that tolerance of pi.
        Parameters:
        t - A tolerance.
        Returns:
        Whether the angle is within that tolerance of straight.

      • measure

        public double measure()
        Gives the measure of the angle, in radians.
        Returns:
        The measure of the angle.

      • render

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Renders the angle on a Java graphics canvas.
        Parameters:
        g - A Java graphics canvas.

      • arrayFromPoints

        public static Angle[] arrayFromPoints​(Point[] points)
        Generates an array of angles from an array of points. Starting with the second point and ending with the second to last, the points become vertices of angles with the two points next to them forming the arms of the angle. There is no wrapping; the last angle is the one with the second to last point as its vertex.
        Parameters:
        points - A list of points.
        Returns:
        The points transformed into a corresponding list of angles.

      • rotate

        public Angle rotate​(double theta)
        Rotates an angle about its vertex.
        Parameters:
        theta - An amount to rotate the angle by.
        Returns:
        The rotated angle.
